result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina M Henrichs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/full time schooling or combination thereof or at any time she does not meet that requirement, she must complete 10 hours of community service per week.
No contact with D.L. unless as approved by PO.

Complete SAFE intake program and any follow up.  Complete LEAP program.  Any other assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  AODA.  Absolute sobriety. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S for RULES VIOLATIONS.  Jail time with huber for work, treatment, child care if eligible under jail classification system.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina M Henrichs

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 12 months probation.
CONDITIONS: 30 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/child care if eligible under jail classification system, I&S to be used for rule violation; Complete SAFE intake program and any follow up; Complete LEAP program; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA; Absolute sobriety CC including domestic abuse surcharge; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof or at any time she does not meet that requirement, she must complete 10 hours of CS/week; N/C w/D.L. (victim) unless as approved by PO.
